info.name: 14. Generating Reports
info.description:
**Reports :**

**Precondition** : Should have nodejs and newman

**Offical sites** :

a) **HTML Reports** : [https://www.npmjs.com/package/newman-reporter-htmlextra](https://www.npmjs.com/package/newman-reporter-htmlextrab))

b) **Junit Reports** : [https://www.npmjs.com/package/newman-reporter-junitfullreport](https://www.npmjs.com/package/newman-reporter-junitfullreport)

_**_

**A) HTML REPORTS :**

**Install via command prompt**: npm i newman-reporter-htmlextra

**cmd >** C:\\Users\\dharani.chandrasekar>npm i -g newman-reporter-htmlextra

**Steps to generate the Reports:**

**1** Export the collection from postman (or) copy the  
collection id from postman

**2** Save in desktop or any location

**3** Copy the collection name and execute in cmd session

**Syntax** : newman run “xxxxxxcollection.json” –r htmlextra

**example**. C:\\Users\\dharani.chandrasekar\\Desktop>newman run "!!!!!! REST Request.postman_collection.json" -r htmlextra

---

**B ) JUNIT REPORTS:**

Install via command prompt: npm i newman-reporter-junitfullreport

**cmd >** C:\\Users\\dharani.chandrasekar>npm i -g newman-reporter-junitfullreport

**Steps to generate the Reports:**

**1** Export the collection from postman (or) copy the  
collection id from postman

**2** Save in desktop or any location

**3** Copy the collection name and execute in cmd session

**Syntax**: newman run “xxxxCollection.json” -r junit --reporter-junit-export

**Example** : C:\\Users\\dharani.chandrasekar\\Desktop>newman run "!!!!!! REST Request.postman_collection.json" -r junit --reporter-junit-export

---
